intro: Effusiella pseudocheila, commonly known as the narrow-leaved spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically narrow and slightly hairy. The plant produces small, unisexual flowers clustered in cyathia, which are surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Effusiella pseudocheila is adapted to drought conditions and can thrive in low-nutrient environments.
